clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability and Preliminary Efficacy of Lenodiar Pediatric in Diarrhea
clinical_study.official_title: Safety, Tolerability and Preliminary Efficacy of Oral Administration of Tannins and Flavonoids in the Management of Pediatric Diarrhea

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the efficacy of a treatment with Actitan-F, a natural molecular complex of tannins (from Agrimony and Tormentil) and flavonoids (Chamomile) in a pediatric population of children affected by acture/prolonged/chronic diarrhea

primary_outcome.measure: Acute (onset <7 days) or Prolonged Diarrhea (onset ≥7 and ≤14 days): Response Rate (RR) measured after 4 treatment days.
primary_outcome.description: Acute (onset <7 days) or Prolonged Diarrhea (onset ≥7 and <14 days): Response Rate (RR) measured after 4 treatment days. Patients will be considered as responders if they have experienced the passage of 2 formed stools or no stool for at least 12 consecutive hours during the 4 days treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Chronic Diarrhea (onset >14 days): Response Rate (RR) measured across the whole treatment period
primary_outcome.description: Chronic Diarrhea (onset >14 days): Response Rate (RR) measured across the whole treatment period (4 weeks). Patients will be considered as responders if they have experienced a 50% (or more) reduction in the number of days with at least 1 diarrheic stools (Bristol score 6 or 7) in the whole treatment period (4 weeks) compared to the 7 days prior the treatment (baseline).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of episodes of daily watery evacuations
secondary_outcome.description: Number of episodes of daily watery evacuations evaluated by means of the electronic patient diaries;

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of unformed stools passed per 24-h interval, after the first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Number of unformed stools passed per 24-h interval, after dosing evaluated by means of the electronic patient diaries

Number of treatment failures. A treatment failure is defined as clinical deterioration or worsening of symptoms or illness continuing after 120 h following the first dose evaluated by means of the electronic patient diaries
Difference in body weight between baseline and End of Treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and severity of diarrhea associated symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency and severity of diarrhea associated symptoms (nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain). Severity will be evaluated by means of a 0-4 Likert scale (0 = none; 1 = mild; 2 = moderate; 3 = severe; 4 = very severe);
Evaluation of the nr of sachets prescribed by the investigators and the % of compliance recorded

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients requiring other (allowed) treatments
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients requiring other treatments in addition to Lenodiar Pediatric or to other concomitant treatments prescribed at baseline visit for diarrhea symptoms relief (e.g. parenteral rehydration and/or other medications) evaluated by means of the electronic patient diaries

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in results of the Pediatric Quality of Life Questionnaire (PedsQL)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in results of the Pediatric Quality of Life Questionnaire (PedsQL) between baseline and End of Treatment visits

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in results in parent assessment of children Quality of Life (100 mm VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in results in parent assessment of children Quality of Life (100 mm VAS) between baseline and End of Treatment visits

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of the treatment: Incidence of adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs), and rate of study discontinuations due to AEs/SAE;
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs), and rate of study discontinuations due to AEs/SAE;

arm_group.description: LenoDiar Pediatric acts thanks to Actitan-F, a plant-based molecular complex resulting from Aboca research which reduces attacks of diarrhoea and normalises the consistency of stools, helping to rapidly restore a balanced intestinal function. Actitan-F counteracts the inflammation of the intestinal mucous membrane, always present in the case of diarrhoea, through two action mechanisms: a protective action, achieved by forming a barrier-effect film to limit contact with microorganisms and irritants; an antioxidant action on the free radicals which counteracts the irritation of the mucous membrane.
